channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Protesters shut down mine near Huntly
item.description: Anti-mining protesters have shut-down work at the Rotowaro open-cast coal mine, near Huntly in North Waikato.

item.title: Covid-19: 'NZ is in an advantageous position' - WHO spokesperson
item.description: New Zealand is used by a World Health Organisation spokesperson as an example of a country whose Covid-19 response has been effectively communicated to communities.

item.title: Pfizer vaccine 'a very likely prospect' - Megan Woods
item.description: The Minister for Research says the government's pre-purchase agreement for a Covid-19 vaccine is a 'well-judged commitment' it is making.

item.title: Pursuit of van which rammed police car justified - IPCA
item.description: An Independent Police Conduct Authority inquiry has found a pursuit of a van which had rammed a police car was justified even though permission was not granted for it.

item.title: Cannabis referendum: Medical Association now neutral
item.description: The Medical Association has backtracked on its stance opposing the cannabis referendum, and apologised to doctors who feel they were misrepresented.

item.title: Parents say Trust for the disabled was deliberately run down
item.description: Parents whose children were cared for at a purpose-built disability centre in Auckland say there appears to have been a deliberate attempt to run down the site.

item.title: New Zealand joins call for access to social media encrypted data
item.description: New Zealand and its Five Eyes security partners have made another plea for social media companies like Facebook to allow governments to access their encrypted data.

item.title: Thousands of Auckland kids going years without dental checkups
item.description: About 2,500 Auckland children have not had a dental check-up since 2016.

item.title: Grey District considers tighter freedom camping rules
item.description: The Grey District mayor is pushing for new rules on freedom camping and thinks the whole country should follow suit.

item.title: Universities urged to financially assist returning foreign students
item.description: Universities have indicated they were prepared to consider some help for the 250 students that will be allowed into New Zealand, but won't make any decision until the end of the week.

item.title: Lower Hutt death: Police open homicide investigation
item.description: Police have launched a homicide investigation following the unexplained death of a man in Naenae.

item.title: Homeless youth 'not able to get the support they need'
item.description: Homeless teenagers in Auckland are being turned away in droves from housing services which say they cannot cope with demand.

item.title: 'It is idiotic': Illegal penguin selfies may cost $100k, DOC warns
item.description: Selfie hunters posing with little blue penguins in Napier could face a $100,000 fine if caught.

item.title: Water restrictions eased for Auckland businesses
item.description: The taps can be turned back on without restrictions for commercial water users in the Auckland region, much to the relief of water-reliant businesses, but the region's water woes are far from over.

item.title: Dentists told to apologise after woman ends up in hospital
item.description: Two dentists have been told to sharpen up and apologise to a woman who wound up in intensive care with an infected wisdom tooth socket.

item.title: Incoming foreign postgrad students will bring value to NZ - Education NZ
item.description: Education NZ says the government's move to allow up to 250 international PhD and postgraduate students back into the country will be beneficial to New Zealand.

item.title: Napier residents told not to drink dirty tap water as shortages bite
item.description: Napier is at risk of running out of water because demand has skyrocketed, and the council is warning residents not to drink dirty or murky tap water.

item.title: Rare stranding of Tawaki penguin in Taranaki
item.description: A penguin conservationist says the stranding of a Tawaki / Fiordland crested penguin in Taranaki is an extremely rare event.
